title: Fatty Liver Index
description: Diagnoses fatty liver using lab and exam findings. A simple and accurate predictor of hepatic steatosis in the general population.

parameters.name: waist_circumference
parameters.description: Waist circumference measured at midpoint between lower costal margin and iliac crest

ranges.interpretation: Fatty liver ruled out with negative likelihood ratio of 0.2. The probability of fatty liver disease is low.
Fatty liver neither ruled in nor ruled out. Further evaluation may be needed.
Fatty liver ruled in with positive likelihood ratio of 4.3. High probability of fatty liver disease. Consider further evaluation and management.

references: Bedogni G, Bellentani S, Miglioli L, Masutti F, Passalacqua M, Castiglione A, Tiribelli C. The Fatty Liver Index: a simple and accurate predictor of hepatic steatosis in the general population. BMC Gastroenterol. 2006 Nov 2;6:33.

Cuthbertson DJ, Weickert MO, Lythgoe D, Sprung VS, Dobson R, Shoajee-Moradie F, et al. External validation of the fatty liver index and lipid accumulation product indices, using 1H-magnetic resonance spectroscopy, to identify hepatic steatosis in healthy controls and obese, insulin-resistant individuals. Eur J Endocrinol. 2014 Nov;171(5):561-9.

Koehler EM, Schouten JN, Hansen BE, Hofman A, Stricker BH, Janssen HL. External validation of the fatty liver index for identifying nonalcoholic fatty liver disease in a population-based study. Clin Gastroenterol Hepatol. 2013 Sep;11(9):1201-4.
formula: FLI = (e^y / (1 + e^y)) × 100, where y = 0.953 × ln(triglycerides) + 0.139 × BMI + 0.718 × ln(GGT) + 0.053 × waist circumference - 15.745
notes: Patients with HCV, HBV, and other liver diseases were excluded from validation
Waist circumference measurement is critical for accuracy
Natural logarithm (ln) is used for triglycerides and GGT values
Accuracy of 0.84 (95% CI 0.81-0.87) in detecting fatty liver
